Administer webformsÂ¶

Aim: Set the email and form settings for webforms and analyse the results.

You need:

  • A webform (see `Add a webform`_)

Time: 20 min

## Email settings

Add an email address for webform notifications

The email settings page allows you to send notification emails when a form has been submitted.

  • Go to a webform page and click on the tab. The tab is now marked in blue and â+ Form componentsâ is added to the tab. Click on â+ Form componentsâ and select the option.

  • To send notification to a specific email select âAddressâ, enter the respective email address and click on the button. Save the email settings as they are.

  • To send a confirmation message to the user who submitted the form select âComponent valueâ, select the field that contains the email of the user and click on the button. This will only work if you have used an email type field in our webform.

    • In the âE-mail templateâ section select âCustom templateâ in the drop down menu and enter some custom text in the field below, e.g. âThank you for registeringâ¦â

      Webform form settings page

Form settingsÂ¶

The form settings page allows you to add a confirmation message to the website and limit submissions.

  • Go to a webform page and click on the tab. The tab is now marked in blue and â+ Form componentsâ is added to the tab. Click on â+ Form componentsâ and select the

    option.

  • Add a confirmation message. This message will appear on the screen after the user has submitted the form.

  • Under PER USER SUBMISSION LIMIT limit each user to 1 submission ever. Save.

ResultsÂ¶

Submit the form a couple of times to test the confirmation message and notification emails.

  • To view the resulting submission click on the tab. The tab is now marked in blue and â+ Submissionsâ is added to the tab. On the Submissions page you see a list of all submissions and can view, edit or delete single submissions.

    List of webform submissions

  • Click on â+ Submissionsâ and select the <+ Analysis> option. You will be presented with statistics for each field.

    Analysis of webform results

  • Click on â+ Analysisâ and select the <+ Table> option to view all submissions in a table format.

  • Click on â+ Tableâ and select the <+ Download> option to download the results as a delimited text or Excel file. There are various option for selecting the fields and format for the download.

  • The last results option is <+ Clear>. This will delete all submission, so be careful before you clear the form.
